unnormalised: ## Finding My Shanti: A Journey Through Yoga Practices
normalised: ## Finding My Shanti: A Journey Through Yoga Practices

unnormalised: My yoga journey started, like many others, with a desire to find a little more peace in the chaos of daily life. Between juggling work deadlines and the constant Delhi traffic, my stress levels were hitting peak heights. My friend, Priya, a seasoned yogini, suggested I ditch the coffee and try a surya namaskar instead.
normalised: My yoga journey started, like many others, with a desire to find a little more peace in the chaos of daily life. unnormalised: Honestly, my first few sessions were a disaster. I couldn't hold a downward dog for more than 10 seconds without wobbling. But the instructor at the local studio near Connaught Place, a calm and patient woman named Anita ji, encouraged me to listen to my body and find what felt right. She explained that yoga wasn't about achieving perfect poses; it was about connecting with myself and cultivating mindfulness.

unnormalised: Over time, I began to explore different yoga practices. Hatha yoga provided a solid foundation, focusing on holding postures and breathwork. Then I dabbled in Vinyasa, enjoying the flowing movements and the cardiovascular benefits. It was definitely more of a workout! I even tried a restorative yoga class, which was basically like a guided nap – pure bliss.

unnormalised: I've learned so much, not just about physical flexibility, but also about the power of breath and presence. Pranayama techniques like Kapalabhati have become my go-to for clearing my head before important meetings. Now, even a quick 15-minute session in my living room (measuring roughly 150 sq ft), listening to some calming flute music, can drastically shift my mood.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma, my family physician, even commented on my improved blood pressure during my last checkup. He attributed it, at least in part, to the stress-reducing effects of yoga. He even joked about prescribing surya namaskars instead of Rs. 5000 worth of medicine!

unnormalised: My journey is far from over. I still struggle with certain poses, and some days, I’d rather binge-watch Netflix. But I know that even a little bit of yoga can make a big difference in my overall well-being. It’s about progress, not perfection. And finding my own personal shanti amidst the everyday hum. Maybe next, I'll try a yoga retreat in Rishikesh!
